description.narrative: Malia Invest (Holding) sal (Malia Invest or the Company), a Lebanese company focused on developing projects in Iraq, is proposing to set up a multi-use branded extended stay greenfield commercial property project comprising of 20 floors in Erbil, Iraq (the Project). The property will be managed by Rotana Hotel Management Corporation, an independent and internationally reputable hospitality management company. The Project will consist of (i) 154 keys serviced apartments. (ii) two floors of serviced offices space ; (iv) an all day dining restaurant, roof top bar and gym; and (vi) a 100 parking spaces. The Company has obtained an investment license and has leased a plot of land with a total surface of 2,300 square meter (sqm) and total builtup area of the project is 23,665 sqm. Malia Invest currently owns the 201 keys five stars hotel in Erbil (called the Erbil Rotana) located close the project site, and has been in operation since 2010. The Project is being set up by the Company with a view to capture an increasing demand for service apartments in the growing city of Erbil, where a large number of businesses are setting up their presence.

The Project will foster the development of business infrastructure in Erbil through (i) providing much needed business infrastructure to the employees of development institutions, diplomats, government workers, NGOs, investors, as well as many private companies that are involved in rebuilding Iraq that frequently use Erbil as their home base during their stay and work in other parts of Iraq; (ii) benefiting the municipal city planning by providing infrastructure for business development such as conference rooms and business centers; (iii) creating outsourcing opportunities, (iv) creating employment (around 110 employees); and (v) extensive hotel training that will be provided by Rotana prior to and during operations, which is expected to enhance the overall service quality standards for the hospitality industry in the region.

name.narrative: The Project is being built on the leased land on the new 100 Avenue in the Erbil City of Kurdistan, Iraq. This land was owned by the Erbil Municipality and was subsequently transferred to the Board of Investment (BOI), Government of Kurdistan. With the development of Erbil as a key city of Kurdistan, the land has now become central and a prime location. The Company has indicated that no resettlement or expropriation was necessary to secure this land. All necessary permits have been obtained, including construction permit, Ministry of Environment approvals, BOI licenses, Municipality approvals.
